text: :"Nebridius" was also the name of a close friend of Augustine of Hippo, who is mentioned in his letters. Saint Nebridius (, ) was bishop of Egara (Terrassa) (516–527)St. Nebridius - Catholic Online and then bishop of Barcelona from 540 to around 547 AD. His feast day falls on 9 February.Los Santos De Febrero A native of Girona,Víctor Balaguer, Historia de Cataluña y de la Corona de Aragón (Barcelona: S. Manero, 1860), p. 126. Nebridius, according to tradition, had three brothers who were also saints. They were Saint Justus, bishop of Urgell; Saint Elpidius; and Saint Justinian.Víctor Balaguer, Historia de Cataluña y de la Corona de Aragón (Barcelona: S. Manero, 1860), p. 126. He was very learned and wrote interpretations of the Scriptures. He also wrote a work called In cantica canticorum about the church chants.Víctor Balaguer, Historia de Cataluña y de la Corona de Aragón (Barcelona: S. Manero, 1860), 126. He was a Benedictine.Sociedad de literatos, La vuelta por España: Viaje histórico, geográfico, científico... (Barcelona: P.
